posts.name: Can Toğran
posts.cooked:
Hello,

We have been building a shuffleboard for our team this year using its custom widgets. We can display the field and the robot’s position, reading from odometry and thus we can see it move on the field on our shuffleboard. One problem is that we would also like to display autonomous trajectories on that field as a line plot.

Any ideas for showing the planned paths that the robot would follow in the autonomous period?

Thanks.

posts.name: Jack R
posts.cooked: I know this doesnt answer your question (I’ll investigate later and see whats possible)  but you can run the PathPlannerLib server in a practice environment and open PathPlanner and view the partial trajectories (to one stop at a time) there.

posts.name: team5682zs
Can Toğran
posts.cooked: Thank you for the reply. Do you know whether it is applicable to swerve as well?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: By the looks of it, it should. It’s a feature of field2d not the drive controller.

posts.name: team5682zs
posts.cooked:
team5682zs:

mple will do a behavior similar to what you are describing. The Field2d from SmartDashboard will create a Field2dObject or grouped Field2D objects when using the getObject method. s

Yep, just check out the SwerveControllerCommand and make sure you have the methods in the drivetrain subsystem to support it.

posts.name: Jainish Patel
posts.cooked: How would you erase the trajectory? I want to update my field widget so it shows another trajectory if another option is chosen.

posts.name: Oliver
posts.cooked:
To remove the trajectory you could set it to an empty trajectory with:

To replace it with a different trajectory you would do it the same way as setting it initially:

You can also have multiple trajectories on the same field if you use a different key for each of them ( "traj1" , "traj2" , "canBeAnything" ) in the getObject call.

posts.name: Jainish Patel
posts.cooked: Thanks, how would you see what option is picked in SendableChooser? Currently my SendableChooser is like this: SendableChooser<Command> If I use chooser.getSelected() it returns a command.

posts.name: system
